overall.description: Compute the one-dimensional discrete Fourier Transform for real input.

n.description: Number of points along transformation axis in the input to use. If n is smaller than the length of the input, the input is cropped. If it is larger, the input is padded with zeros. If n is not given, the length of the input along the axis specified by axis is used.

axis.description: Axis over which to compute the FFT. If not given, the last axis is used.

norm.description: New in version 1.10.0.  Normalization mode (see numpy.fft). Default is None.

out.description: The truncated or zero-padded input, transformed along the axis indicated by axis, or the last one if axis is not specified. If n is even, the length of the transformed axis is (n/2)+1. If n is odd, the length is (n+1)/2.
